evidence.text: The defendants’ motion to dismiss [45] is GRANTED in Part, DENIED in Part, and DENIED as moot in Part. The motion is DENIED to the extent it seeks dismissal of the complaint for lack of jurisdiction. The motion is GRANTED to the extent it seeks dismissal of the second amended complaint as a shotgun pleading. The motion is DENIED as moot in all other respects. The second amended complaint is DISMISSED without prejudice.

extracted.value: The defendants’ motion to dismiss (Doc. #45) was GRANTED in Part, DENIED in Part, and DENIED as moot in Part. The motion was DENIED to the extent it sought dismissal of the complaint for lack of jurisdiction, GRANTED to the extent it sought dismissal of the second amended complaint as a shotgun pleading, and DENIED as moot in all other respects. The second amended complaint was DISMISSED without prejudice. Decision entered March 2, 2021.

evidence.text: The Motion [127] is GRANTED IN PART and DENIED IN PART. To the extent the Defendants seek dismissal of the Plaintiffs’ claims against Marshal Turner, the Court finds that the claims should be dismissed to the same extent its previous Order [87] dismissed the claims against the other Defendants, but no further. All other relief is DENIED. The previously-imposed stay is hereby LIFTED.

extracted.value: The Motion [127] was GRANTED IN PART and DENIED IN PART. The defendants’ request to dismiss claims against Marshal Turner was dismissed to the extent previously ordered, while all other relief was DENIED. The previously-imposed stay was LIFTED and a status conference will be held. Decision entered March 22, 2023.
